message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV 

The paper proposes a learning framework for robots to follow natural language route directions without prior knowledge of the environment. This involves utilizing spatial and semantic information conveyed through the command to learn a distribution over the metric and semantic properties of spatially extended environments. The algorithm uses this distribution to interpret the natural language instruction as a distribution over the intended behavior, and a belief space planner reasons directly over the map and behavior distributions to solve for a policy using imitation learning. This work involves robotics (cs.RO), natural language processing (cs.CL), machine learning (cs.AI), and possibly computer vision (cs.CV) and statistical learning (cs.LG).
